result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paula R. Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Paula R. Boyd
Current: 321 Broadway Av, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2016)
Prior: 510 East St, Merrill, WI 54452

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M. Goetz.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF166 and 13CF257 also called - 14CF166 and 14CF257 DRI - Count 1 in 13CF242 charging language amended from intoxicants to alcohol - AODA has already been completed - 5 days jail credit due - Plea no contest to counts 1 and 2 - Counts 3 & 4 DRI -  Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguments by Dunphy/Goetz/Defendant/Court  to sentencing - 11:00am - 11:00pm requested child care by defense - Court orders jail 125 days with huber to commence immediately - 5 days credit - $600 fine plus costs/assessments - Count 2 costs/surcharges - pay within 60 days or set up payment plan - 24 month d/l revocation - IID 24 months - AODA and safety plan (already completed)  Court will allow huber for work release/child care and eligible for electronic monitoring (up to jail rules) - Firearms restrictions - Post conviction rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M. Goetz.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests case be adjourned - Defendant will remain on bond - Court adds that may not enter taverns unless for work purposes  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M. Goetz.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Josh McCaskill called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Defendant identified by witness - Cross by Goetz - Arguments by Dunphy/Goetz to probable cause - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt of information - Waive reading - Plea not guilty - Bond continued  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2014 at 03:50 pm.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M. Goetz.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's witness does not appear - Does not know the reason for his non-appearance - Notice had been sent - State requests adjournemnt - Statements by Goetz - Bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 03:50 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Geotz was appearing via phone but lost contact - Now appears via phone - Time limits for hearing preliminary hearing waived -  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court, in custody via video.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Right to counsel - Dunphy to bail - Court questions defendant - Court sets $1500 bond - $250 cash with the balance of Sig - Prelim set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
